text:
I can only guess at that part a bit unfortunately, since i have close to zero experience with concept art work...concept art/design seems like a small circle of people that are being called upon for projects based on previous results, trust that they can deliver results again and have a good relationship with the directors/showrunners/etc so they know they're good to work with. So it's probably not a field that you can just throw endless numbers of artists at to deliver lots of stuff quickly. That probably makes it more competitive
On the other hand i feel that would be balanced out by how few people have that actual talent required? :slightly_smiling_face:  Not saying fx/comp/etc doesn't require a certain talent, but it's definitely different than actually being able to draw and do that creative work...
Sorry that i can't help more / be more specific with this :upside_down_face:

Yeah, access to more powerful software (either for editing or whatever field you're working in) is definitely a problem a beginning and it really is a shame that there are few (if any) good apps out there. Hopefully (or most likely) that will resolve (heehee) itself as time goes on...either because more/better free apps will be available or you'll simply be able to afford the odd piece of software here and there from your work

What did you do to expand your network??

Even if I post my art a lot, if it doesn't really get seen by employers then it's fruitless for exposure... Should I simply reach out to them?
